main_definition: Pixels refer to the smallest units of a digital image or display, representing points in an electronic image.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Elemental unit of digital images and displays
meanings_and_examples.example: The photo had millions of pixels that made it incredibly detailed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Adjusting the sharpness or clarity of a digital image by manipulating individual pixels
meanings_and_examples.example: She used an editing software to increase the number of pixels for sharper images.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A measure of image resolution, with higher pixel counts indicating more detail
meanings_and_examples.example: The 1080p TV has a high pixel count compared to standard definition screens.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In gaming or animation, the pixels that make up each frame in an animated sequence
meanings_and_examples.example: Each frame of the animation is composed of thousands of individual pixels.
